text: (soft music)

- Etihad is the national
airline of United Arab Emirates.

And, hospitality is a
key part of the culture.

So, excelling in customer
service is important

and having a technology
solution that provides

that easy to use, customer
friendly user experience
is what we want to achieve.
For this specific project

I wanted a totally
different way of leveraging

solving new technologies,
new cloud capabilities.

What I was looking for is a
partner that would enable us

to go down this journey
as fast as possible.
Working with IBM, leveraging the IBM Cloud
allows us to do that.
So one of our challenge is the fact

that the airline industry uses
a lot of legacy technologies.
To provide a transparent and seamless
cross channel experience you need to have
the right platforms in place that deliver

the functionality across all
devices and all use cases.

We use the IBM Garage
co-creation type methodology.

So, we brought together
Etihad business stakeholders,
IBM technologies and other companies.
And within in a week the team came back

with a working prototype
where you can print
and email a boarding card.

Very quick and successful
proof of concept gave me
the confidence that we can connect

to the backend systems
and deliver a product
that would be acceptable.
Using API Connect we are able to connect
very easily to legacy systems.
Or existing systems like Saver
but also new technologies like WhatsApp.

Within 15 weeks we
launched the first release
for the minimum viable product.

The deployment efficiency
which would normally take us

weeks in the old world are
happening, matter of minutes.
